name: execute_python
description: Execute Python code using the in-browser Pyodide runtime. Supports NumPy, SciPy, pandas, matplotlib, and other scientific libraries. Use this for mathematical computations, data analysis, algorithm implementation, or tasks requiring Python's scientific computing ecosystem.

code.description: Python code to execute. Must be valid Python 3.11 syntax. The code runs in an isolated Pyodide environment with access to standard library and pre-installed scientific packages.

install_packages.description: Optional list of Python packages to install from PyPI before execution (e.g., ['requests', 'beautifulsoup4']). Common packages like numpy, scipy, pandas are pre-installed.

sync_workspace.description: Whether to sync the VFS workspace to Pyodide filesystem before execution, allowing Python code to read/write VFS artifacts.

name: write_artifact
description: Creates or updates an artifact in the Virtual File System. This enables self-modification and evolution. Use responsibly.

path.description: The VFS path where the artifact should be written (e.g., '/modules/ui-style.css').

content.description: The content to write to the artifact.

metadata.description: Optional metadata about this write operation.

reason.description: Why this artifact is being created or modified.

name: delete_artifact
description: Deletes an artifact from the Virtual File System. Use with extreme caution.

path.description: The VFS path of the artifact to delete.

reason.description: Required: Explanation of why this artifact is being deleted.
